data.title: CALENDAR OF EVENTS
data.meta_description: St. Petersburg Power & Sailboat Show Jan. 19-22 The largest boat show on the Gulf Coast. Explore an impressive selection of powerboats and sailboats in-water and on land, including a 40,000 square foot tent housing an extraordinary display of marine gear and accessories. General admission is $21
data.text:
St. Petersburg Power & Sailboat Show

Jan. 19-22

The largest boat show on the Gulf Coast. Explore an impressive selection of powerboats and sailboats in-water and on land, including a 40,000 square foot tent housing an extraordinary display of marine gear and accessories. General admission is $21 for adults; kids (15 and under), active duty military and veterans are free with proof of service. For schedule, information and tickets: www.stpeteboatshow.com.

Englewood Seafood & Music Festival

Jan. 20-22

Delicious foods, live music and shopping through a marketplace of arts, crafts and fine products are all features of the 4th Annual Englewood Seafood & Music Festival. Choose from a variety of seafood, meat and vegetarian dishes all cooked fresh on site. Listen to Florida’s top musical groups from genres such as R&B, blues, jazz, rock and Caribbean sounds. Free admission. 4-10 p.m. Friday; 11 a.m.-10 p.m., Saturday; 11 a.m.-6 p.m. Sunday. This year, due to construction in Dearborn Street Plaza, the event is moving to the Englewood Plaza at 200 S. Indiana Ave. (S.R. 776). www.paragonfestivals.com/festival/englewood-seafood-music-festival.

Sarasota Open Air Fine Art Show

Jan. 21-22

The focus of the show is visual arts, fine arts and fine crafts created by award-winning artists from around the world with all disciplines for sale — paintings, clay, glass, sculpture, fiber, wood, jewelry and more — all juried by art professionals. Features great food from local area restaurants and music. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. at Phillippi Estate Park, 5500 S. Tamiami Trail, Sarasota. Free admission; $5 parking.

Joy of Jazz

Jan. 22

The Jazz Club and the Gulf Coast Community co-sponsor a free jazz concert from 2-4 p.m. at the gazebo in Centennial Park 200 W. Venice Ave, Venice. Bring chairs or blanket for seating. Performers TBA. www.jazzclubsarasota.org.

Cornhole Happy Hour

Jan. 25

You are invited to a cornhole happy hour at Wellen Park Welcome Center and enjoy a game or two while enjoying happy hour “Meet & Mingle” with fellow residents and learn more about the game of cornhole. Play a game or two with your fellow neighbors and enjoy happy hour on us! This is a free event. Free cornhole and two free drink tickets per person. 6-9 p.m. Wednesday, Jan. 25, at Wellen Park Welcome Center, 12275 Mercado Drive, Venice.

7th Annual Sarasota Seafood and Music Festival

Jan. 27-29

Featuring family entertainment, local bands with a variety of live music, food vendors, arts and crafts vendors, kids activities, magicians, face painters and more. Live musical performances in genres from rock, jazz, R&B, big band, calypso and Caribbean sounds. Food, music and family fun. Marketplace of arts and crafts (e.g., painting, jewelry, ceramics, woodworking) along with gourmet food items and specialty products. Free admission and parking where you can find it. 4-10 p.m. Friday; 11 a.m.-10 p.m. Saturday; 11 a.m.-6 p.m. Sunday at JD Hamel Park, 199 Bayfront Drive, Sarasota. www.paragonfestivals.com/festival/sarasota-seafood-music-festival-2.

2023 Seminole Hard Rock Gasparilla Pirate Fest

Jan. 28

Take a short drive to downtown Tampa for this annual event. Open from 9 a.m.-9 p.m. The Gasparilla Invasion is from 11:30 a.m.-1 p.m., complete with the annual reenactment of Tampa’s historic pirate invasion at 1 p.m. at the Tampa Convention Center. The Gasparilla Parade Of Pirates is from 2 p.m.-6 p.m. and begins at Bay to Bay and Bayshore Boulevard. It continues along Bayshore Boulevard to Brorein Street, turns east on Brorein Street, then north on Ashley Drive. Event is free and open to the public. main.gasparillapiratefest.com

Sarasota County Fire Fest

Jan. 28

This fun family event takes a look at how prescribed burns protect our communities and property from wildfires and maintains Florida’s natural ecosystems for present and future generations. Do you ever wonder why you see all those smoke columns across the horizon? Agencies from around the state come together to talk fire. Enjoy live fire demonstrations, helicopter bucket drops and nature tours. Kids will have a blast on the SWAT obstacle course and will enjoy fun games and face painting in the KidZone. Free admission. 10 a.m.-2 p.m. (rain or shine) at T. Mabry Carlton Jr. Memorial Reserve (Carlton Reserve). 1800 Mabry Carlton Parkway, Venice. www.scgov.net.

12th Annual Chili, Beer & Blues Fest

Jan. 28

A fun day full of great live music, great chili and more than 50 craft beers to experience on the waterfront in Punta Gorda. Live bands include Deb & the Dynamics, Mike Imbasaciani & his BluezRockerz, and Shaw Davis & The Black Ties. Large craft beer pavilion, food vendors, chili teams, full liquor bar. Advance general admission, $8 ($10 at the gate). 11 a.m.- 6 p.m. in Laishley Park 150 Laishley Court, Punta Gorda. www.eventbrite.com/e/12th-annual-charlotte-harbor-chili-beer-and-blues-fest-tickets-467992396857.

Repticon Sarasota

Jan. 28-29

A two-day expo highlighting reptile shows, events, activities and sales. You’ll have a chance to see live reptiles from around the world, plus the chance to purchase pets and supplies direct from experts. 9 a.m.-4 p.m. Saturday, Jan. 28, and 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Sunday, Jan. 29, at Sarasota County Fairgrounds, Robarts Arena, 3000 Ringling Blvd., Sarasota. Ticket prices vary, and tickets are available online only. Tickets not sold at the door. www.repticon.com/florida/Sarasota.

15th Annual Downtown Venice Craft Festival

Jan. 28-29

This festival features a blend of contemporary crafts, all handmade in the United States. You’ll find a wide variety of ceramics, jewelry, stained glass, metal works and much more. In addition, the Green Market offers live flora, freshly popped kettle corn, gourmet spices and sauces. Free admission. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. at West Venice Avenue in downtown Venice.

20th Annual St. Armands Circle’s Art Festival

Jan. 28-29

Check out this festival for fun and creativity at new levels. Usually held on the last weekend in January on St. Armands Circle in Circle Park, there are more than 200 artists and craftsmen displaying their works from across the globe in a prestigious show encompassing life-sized sculpture, fine jewelry, exquisite works of art and handcrafted apparel and decor. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Free admission.

Sarasota Florida Antiques Show

Jan. 28-29

Features a full show of outstanding booths of antiques, spectacular jewelry, art and objects of virtue and more. Specialty booths will show Tiffany, Pairpoint and other special pieces of antique lighting; rare instruments and barometers; fine pieces of Americana; European, Asian and American antiques; and much more. Admission: $8. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturday, and 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Sunday, at Sarasota Municipal Auditorium, 801 N. Tamiami Trail, Sarasota.

The Venice Symphony: “Cinematic Romance”

Feb. 3-4

The orchestra performs at the Venice Performing Arts Center, 1 Indian Ave., Venice, with music from “Casablanca,” “Romeo and Juliet” and “Gone With the Wind.” Superstar violinist Sandy Cameron will perform Danny Elfman’s “Edward Scissorhands Suite,” “Love Theme” from “Cinema Paradiso” and the “Tango (Por Una Cabeza)” from “Scent of a Woman” For the finale, you’ll hear Leonard Bernstein’s sweeping “Symphonic Dances” from the enduring classic “West Side Story.” Tickets available at www.thevenicesymphony.org, or by calling 941-207- 8822 or visiting the box office, 1515 S. Tamiami Trail, Suite 7, Venice.

Walking Group Meetup

Feb. 4

Calling all walking enthusiasts: What better way to enjoy the beautiful Wellen Park community, stay in shape and meet like-minded friends than participating in a walking group? On the first Saturday of each month, residents are invited to meet at 9 a.m. at the Wellen Park Welcome Center to participate in a walking group. A community ambassador will greet the group and share a map of the various pathways. It’s up to you how far you want to walk. Each participant will also be given one free drink ticket to redeem at the adjacent café, Louie’s Bistro, so you can enjoy your beverage of choice with your new walking buddies. Whether you are a “stroller” or a “power walker,” there are sure to be others in the group who match your pace. 9 a.m. Saturday, Feb. 4, at Wellen Park Welcome Center, 12275 Mercado Drive, Venice.

8th Annual “Airing of the Quilts”

Feb. 4

Young and old are invited to Sarasota Modern Quilt Guild’s 8th Annual “Airing of the Quilts” Quilt Show and Sale.” See modern quilts made by talented members of the guild and find quilts and other boutique items for sale. Quilts will be hung under and around the Big Pavilion in a beautiful beach-side park. Admission is free. Food trucks on premises. 10 a.m.-3 p.m. Maxine Barritt Park, at 1800 S. Harbor Drive, Venice.

“Galaxy of Orchids”

Feb. 4-5

The Venice Area Orchid Society presents its 54th annual show and sale, “Galaxy of Orchids.” Thousands of blooming orchids will be for sale and on display in 15 artistically designed exhibits. Orchid art, accessories and supplies will also be for sale. Widely regarded as the most popular orchid show on Florida’s west coast. Admission is $5; children under 10 are free. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturday, and 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Sunday, at Venice Community Center, 326 S. Nokomis Ave., Venice. www.vaos.org.

Palm Grove Amish Quilt & Craft Show

Feb. 8-11

Quilts, quilts & more quilts are the highlights of this event. See beautiful quilts of all sizes (mostly Amish made) and a variety of handmade crafts for sale — and watch quilters at work. Admission: $3 donation for charity. 8 a.m.-5 p.m. Wednesday-Friday, and 8 a.m.-noon Saturday, at Palm Grove Mennonite Church, 1087 Beneva Road, Sarasota.

Florida State Fair

Feb. 9-20

First established in 1904, this annual event is incredibly popular and features way too many highlights to mention. Admission: $6-$50. Open 11 a.m.-9 p.m. daily at the fairgrounds.4800 U.S. 301 N., Tampa. www.floridastatefair.com.

Free Music Friday Night Concert Series

Feb. 10

Hear the live music of Kit M. Jones at the gazebo in downtown Venice’s Centennial Park. Bring your own chairs and blankets. No alcohol permitted in Centennial Park. Admission is free. 7-9 p.m. 200 W. Venice Ave., Venice.

59th Annual Shell Show

Feb. 10-11

Presented by the Sarasota Shell Club, the Sarasota Shell Show is one of the largest shell shows in the world. You’ll find beautiful shell crafts and rare shell exhibits displayed from around the world. Admission: $5 for adults, $2.50 for students (ages 12-18), free for children 12 and under (with paid adult). 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Friday and Saturday in the Potter Building at the Sarasota County Fair Grounds, 3000 Ringling Blvd., Sarasota. www.sarasotashellclub.com/2022-shell-show.

Circus Sarasota

Feb. 10-March 5

Celebrating 25 years, previous headliners have included comic daredevil and Sarasota’s own international star, Bello Nock, and Sarasota’s high-wire artist Nik Wallenda. Every year features a new cast in an intimate one-ring European-style big top. This year, the big top moves to Regatta Island at Nathan Benderson Park. Don’t miss this international cast of circus artists, many of whom have appeared on “America’s Got Talent,” in thrilling performances. Various tickets prices and show times. 5851 Nathan Benderson Circle, Sarasota.

Cycling Group Meetup

Feb. 11 Wellen Park makes it easy to feel good — cultivating physical and emotional well-being for all! On the second Saturday of each month, residents are invited to meet at 9 a.m. at the Wellen Park Welcome Center to participate in a cycling group meetup. A community ambassador will greet the group and share a map of the various trails and pathways. It’s up to you how far you want to cycle. Each participate will also be given one free drink ticket to redeem at the adjacent Louie’s Bistro, so you can enjoy a beverage with your fellow cyclists after you wrap up your ride. 9 a.m. Saturday, Feb. 11, at Wellen Park Welcome Center, 12275 Mercado Drive.

35th Annual Downtown Sarasota Festival of the Arts

Feb. 11-12

Featured are some of the best artists in the nation displaying life-sized sculptures, spectacular paintings, one-of-a-kind jewels, photography and inspired creativity for all to see (and buy). It’s ranked as one of the Top 100 Fine Arts Shows in the country by a national artists magazine. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Main Street in downtown Sarasota.

Sarasota Open Air Fine Art Show

Feb. 11-12

This quality juried fine art and fine craft show brings artists with all disciplines to sell their original and personally handmade art. The focus is visual arts by award-winning artists from around the world, with all disciplines for sale: paintings, clay, glass, sculpture, fiber, wood, jewelry and more. Admission is free; $5 parking fee supports Institute for the Arts & Education Inc. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. at Phillippi Estate Park, 5500 S. Tamiami Trail, Sarasota.

Thunder By The Bay Sarasota Music & Motorcycle Festival

Feb. 17-19

Want to see some great looking motorcycles? How about a bikers’ outdoor festival with food, fun, live music and more? It’ll be a fun weekend as the Thunder By The Bay Sarasota Music & Motorcycle Festival revs up for another year. You’ll see bikes, bikes and more bikes. The event benefits Suncoast Charities for Children. www.escape-to-sarasota.com/thunder-by-the-bay.html.

Venice Antiques Show

Feb. 18-19

This event features more than 50 national and regional exhibitors, and features art glass, pottery, fine are, jewelry Asian and European antiques, and Americana. It also showcases furniture, sterling, toys, Tiffany lamps, cut glass and more. Admission: $8. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturday, and 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Sunday, at Venice Community Center, 326 S. Nokomis Ave., Venice.

20th Annual Fine Arts Show & Sale at the Venice Art Center

Feb. 18-19

Prints, acrylics, oils, watercolors, mixed media, jewelry, glass, pottery, textiles and more, along with an outdoor café to enjoy. Admission: $3 for members, $4 for non-members. 9 a.m.-4 p.m. at Venice Art Center, 390 Nokomis Ave. S., Venice.

34th Annual Venice Italian Feast and Carnival

Feb. 23-26

Held at the Venice Airport Paved Midway, this event features four days of food, fun, dancers, carnival rides and live entertainment — not to mention all your Italian favorite foods, from sausage and peppers to ravioli, chicken and much more. Free admission, $10 parking. Food and carnival rides at cost. Starts at 4 p.m. Thursday and Friday, and noon Saturday and Sunday. www.escape-to-sarasota.com/venice-italian-feast.html.

Free Music Friday Night Concert Series

Feb. 24

Hear the live music of Steve Arvery at the gazebo in downtown Venice’s Centennial Park. Bring your own chairs and blankets. No alcohol permitted in Centennial Park. Admission is free. 7-9 p.m. 200 W. Venice Ave., Venice.

Longboat Key Festival of the Arts

Feb. 25-26

Residents and visitors are invited to stroll this wonder complex amid life-sized sculptures, spectacular paintings, one-of-a-kind jewels, photography, ceramics and more. Local and national artists will be on site to discuss their inspirations and processes for each handmade work. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. at the newly developed Longboat Key Town Center Green, 600 Bay Isles Road, Longboat Key.

Selby Gardens Music Series

Feb. 26

Enjoy the live music of New York City-based singer/songwriter Rae Radick at the Historic Spanish Point campus on Little Sarasota Bay. From classical pianists, folk, country, Latin, pop, soul, and rock ’n’ roll, you’ll hear an eclectic variety of local and international music. Food and beverages available for purchase. Advanced registration is required with guaranteed seating. Free for members and included in general admission for non-members. Historic Spanish Point campus, 337 N. Tamiami Trail, Osprey. www.selby.org/dsc/dsc-special-events/garden-music-series.
